item.title: Report X-2023100954
item.description:
Report X-2023100954

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded from the trailer and loaded onto a tugger cart. The package was then taken to the van lines and loaded underneath the belt. When the driver was loading his van he noticed the box was slightly wet on the corner and called for a manager. QA came and placed the box into a tote lined with a bag. The package was then taken to the QA cage damage area where the package was inspected. DescribePack: the caps on the top of each bottle was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The caps were tightened and the package was placed into a tote lined with a bag.

item.title: Report X-2023100470
item.description:
Report X-2023100470

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/8/2023 at approximatley 2000, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 5433639 at the ramp facility in Seattle, reporting a undeclared corrosive shipment. The shipment consistes 16 bottles of Carpet stair remover. The shipment discovered leaking during loading. A safety data sheet found online revealed that the contents is classified as UN3265. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulatoions, as it was without markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation from the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2023090468
item.description:
Report X-2023090468

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Diesel fuel was observed leaking from the manway on the VMSX 310119 while at the Balmer railyard on 9/8/23. The car was isolated for inspection. Hazmat responders identified the release as coming from the manway sealing area underneath the cover. Upon inspection it was found that the manway gasket had not been applied resulting in a small release of diesel fuel to the car body. Crews added a gasket and secured the car. Release loss estimates are based upon visual observations of the responders.
